intro.description: This cheat sheet tells you general chemistry (or, more strictly speaking, chemoinformatics) tasks you can do in Bioclipse. These are centered around handling molecular data files and calculating their properties.

item.title: Step 0: Prerequisites
item.description: You need the Chemoinformatics feature installed for this (which you have if you read this and have installed Bioclipse via the update site).

item.title: Option 1: Draw and Edit single Structures, handle File Formats
item.description: The JChemPaint editor allows graphical viewing and editing of structures in various formatsa and file format conversion. See help via ? on top of this section for details.

item.title: Option 2: Handle Multiple Structure Files
item.description: Files with multiple structures (SDF and CML) cannot be handled in the JChemPaintEditor. They can be viewed in the SDF Editor (use ? for details). This editor also offers extraction of files (e. g. single files for editing in JChemPaint) and creation of SDFs from several other files.

item.title: Option 3: Calculate QSAR properties
item.description: A wide variety of molecular and atomic qsar descriptory (e.g. XLogP, ALogP, Lipinske Rule of Five, Atomic Polarizability) can be calculated in Bioclipse. See ? for details.

item.title: Option 4: Convert file formats
item.description: You can create 2D and 3D coordinates for molecules. Right click on the file and choose "Generate 2D/3D". See ? for details.

item.title: Option 5: Do whatever with smarts
item.description: TODO the person who did this needs to fill in some high-level text on smarts here

item.title: Option 6: Search in External databases
item.description: You can search in a variety of external (EBI) databases File -> New -> Web Services -> Use WSDbfetch Web Service at EBI. See ? for details.

item.title: Option 7: Work with Spectral Data
item.description: If you want to work with spectral data (e. g. view spectra and peak pick them, do a structure elucidation), you should install the Speclipse feature (in case this is not yet the case) via Help -> Software Update -> Speclipse Update Site (or by choosing "Click to perform" right here) and read the General Spectrum Cheat Sheet.
